results.details: Dataset should have sufficient sample size

biological_validations.name: Genotype-Phenotype Network
biological_validations.description: Network of significant associations between AMR genes and resistance phenotypes
biological_validations.interpretation: Dense networks suggest strong genotype-phenotype relationships. Sparse networks may indicate complex resistance mechanisms.

biological_validations.name: Network Density
biological_validations.description: Proportion of possible edges that are significant
biological_validations.interpretation: High density (>0.3) suggests extensive gene co-selection. Low density indicates independent evolution.

biological_validations.name: Hub Gene Identification
biological_validations.description: Gene with most significant associations (highest degree)
biological_validations.interpretation: Hub genes may be key drivers of resistance phenotypes or located on mobile genetic elements.

biological_validations.name: Gene Communities
biological_validations.description: Groups of co-occurring genes detected by hierarchical clustering
biological_validations.interpretation: Communities may represent resistance islands, plasmids, or functionally related gene clusters.

biological_validations.name: AMR-Virulence Odds Ratio
biological_validations.description: Odds ratio from Fisher's exact test
biological_validations.interpretation: OR>1 suggests positive association. OR<1 suggests negative association.

biological_validations.name: Multiple Testing Correction
biological_validations.interpretation: FDR correction reduces false positives while maintaining statistical power.

biological_validations.name: Mutual Information
biological_validations.description: Information shared between AMR gene and virulence factor
biological_validations.interpretation: Higher MI indicates stronger dependency. MI=0 indicates independence.
